intro: Uropappus lindleyi, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant has small, gray-green leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Uropappus lindleyi is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun and exhibiting drought tolerance.
